definition: lit. not an inch of steel (idiom); unarmed and defenseless
hand/(formal) to hold/person engaged in certain types of work/person skilled in certain types of work/personal(ly)/convenient/classifier for skill/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]

sentences.english: Tanks were sent in agai t unarmed students.
sentences.chinese: 出動坦克車對付手無寸鐵的學生。

sentences.english: Now Mazarin was alone and defenseless, as he well knew.
sentences.chinese: 現在，馬薩林孤身一人，手無寸鐵，他也知道。

sentences.english: Troops indiscriminately massacred the defenceless population.
sentences.chinese: 軍隊肆無忌憚地屠殺手無寸鐵的民衆。

sentences.english: Originally Jujutsu was the method of unarmed combat of the Ancient Samurai.
sentences.chinese: 原本柔術是古代日本武士在手無寸鐵時的格鬥用法。

sentences.english: Bombs rained down on the unarmed common people.
sentences.chinese: 炸彈像雨點一般落在手無寸鐵的老百姓身上。

sentences.english: We dramatized the shooting down of an unarmed black man.
sentences.chinese: 我們全力強調的是一名手無寸鐵的黑人遭到了殺害。

definition: to be devoid of all humanity/inhuman/bestial
fire of war everywhere (idiom); enveloped in the flames of war
to attack with a bladed weapon
not to shrink from any crime (idiom); to commit any imaginable misdeed
after the calamity, renewed life (idiom); new lease of life
variant of 誣衊|诬蔑[wu1 mie4]
to kill sb for his property (idiom); to murder for money
